input.paragraph: I n formation in this presentation is subject to change as Docebo continuously updates its software based on new market needs, new available technologies, defects, and suggested improvements from customers. Docebo makes no representation or warranty of any kind, express or implied, regarding the accuracy, reliability, availability or completeness with respect to this presentation of the information therein. You should not rely upon the material or information in this presentation as a basis for making any business, legal or other decisions. Ultimately, the development, release, and timing of any products, features or functionality remain at the sole discretion of Docebo. An Ideal World A simple way to understand which parts of my learning programs are actually making an impact on my people. Employees, customers or partners that retain what they learn, even months after they’ve learned it. Highly engaged learners that see the value in your learning initiatives and can pinpoint areas most beneficial for career growth. An optimized way to collect feedback on learning programs that doesn’t require hours spent building out evaluation tools and dashboards. Action plans that aim to understand how to best leverage feedback to make my learning programs even better. Sound Familiar? You want: The Challenges You may spend hours building the right tools, which is time consuming and error prone. Doing everything manually at scale isn’t realistic when you have a large number of learners with different goals or outcomes – you’re in over your head. Typical eLearning reporting focuses on quantitative data (like completion tracking), not qualitative. You have no point of reference or benchmarks. How can you tell when a course was effective enough or that the response rate was actionable? Why you aren’t living in your ideal world. * Source Today’s Solutions. Built-in survey features in an LMS. Most learning platforms offer built-in reporting capabilities (including Docebo) and blank templates for evaluations, but you don’t always have the time to build everything out as quickly as you need it. Special survey tools (not for learning). Tools like Surveymonkey aren’t built to scale for multiple learning audiences or multiple courses. You would have to spend a long time tweaking an evaluation for each course, which isn’t realistic. Keep doing what you’re doing. Leaving things as they are is always an option. But how long can you keep doing what you’re doing? And is it helping you optimize your learning program? What are my options right now? Go beyond the numbers to understand the impact of your learning programs. Measure the effectiveness of your learning programs. Improve the impact of your formal training programs and validate your company’s investment in learning with optimized out-of-the-box evaluations and dashboards. Make data-driven decisions, get answers and next steps faster by focusing on qualitative analytics, and compare your data against learning benchmarks to see how you stack up. Make data-driven decisions and demonstrate learning is a strategic investment by connecting it to knowledge retention. Prove Impact at scale Assess your learning programs thoroughly by focusing on the why, using qualitative data that goes beyond the scope of number-driven quantitative data. Drill down on what’s working Maximize learner engagement and and watch your response rates go up. As more feedback rolls in, tweak your programs based on action plans to increase learning experience effectiveness. Increase engagement Compare your data against learning benchmarks from 5+ million evaluations with clean out-of-the-box dashboards that let you immediately pinpoint areas of improvement. Leverage Benchmarks What It’s About Why Docebo Learning Impact Works Step Two Learners receive evaluations upon course completion, while Admins can start seeing results roll in via ready-to-go dashboards. Step Four Leverage reporting results and next-step action plans to tweak your learning programs and increase effectiveness. Step One Enable learning impact evaluations for your courses (as many as you want). Step Three Learners receive follow-up evaluations, Admins continue to monitor results, comparing with benchmarks. Repeat as Necessary

output.sentence: Built-in survey features in an LMS offer built-in reporting capabilities (including Docebo) and blank templates for evaluations.

input.paragraph: Add Docebo Learning Impact to as many courses necessary to measure impact across your entire program. How does it work? The development, release, and timing of any products, features or functionality remain at the sole discretion of Docebo. Measure the effectiveness of your learning programs Learner’s expectations Manager’s expectations Pre-training assessment Initial evaluation Trainer’s feedback Post-training assessment Follow-up evaluation/ Learning transfer evaluation Manager’s involvement End of the course Success Stories Learning Impact A solution allowing scalable evaluation processes as well as more advanced evaluations for strategic courses Learning Culture Index Phase Three: July 2021 C limb another step of Kirkpatrick's pyramid adding evaluations for managers to measure how training affects team performance and behavior. Compare and consolidate results across instructors Provide broader visibility into the quality of training with surveys for instructors. Define the evaluation process key parameters for each course Launch Day! Phase Two: April 2021 E nable Learning Impact massively across your courses (all types). Same evaluation process as in Phase One Leverage advanced reports to consolidate and compare your Learning Impact results on any perimeter. Enable Learning Impact reports for Power Users. Phase One: Live Now E nable Leaning Impact on a course-by-course basis for E-learning, Classroom, and vILT courses. Send the NPS-style evaluations to learners upon course completion, with a follow-up evaluation three months later. Leverage pre-built dashboards per course to check your data against learning benchmarks to gauge learning impact. The Learning Impact Roadmap Additional Resources Discover more about measuring learning impact with this content Measure the effectiveness of your learning programs. A Docebo Learning Suite Product

output.sentence: Compare your data against learning benchmarks from 5+ million evaluations.

input.paragraph: Four Questions Your Board Will Ask You About Cyber Risk

output.sentence: Gartner research found “Eighty-eight percent of Boards of Directors (BoDs) view cybersecurity as a business risk, as opposed to a technology risk.

input.paragraph: What are the biggest risks to our organization today and what are we doing to mitigate them? Your job as a cybersecurity leader is to manage cybersecurity risk, which includes identifying, treating, and monitoring your overall threat landscape. Your response should include results of a comprehensive cybersecurity risk assessment that was recently conducted through an automated platform solution. By employing an automated platform solution, you can continue to monitor and manage cyber risk more continuously to identify new threats and vulnerabilities to the organization as they develop, than compared to point in time assessments. The platform should present the top risk scenarios to your organization, the associated threats and vulnerabilities that inform risk levels. 2. How are we spending our current cybersecurity budget and is it going to the right places? Justifying cybersecurity budgets can be challenging without having the right risk insights. Using an Integrated Cyber Risk Management platform solution with a financial impact view, you can instantly calculate the annualized loss expectancy (ALE) for your top risk scenarios since the solution can assess your IT environment to discovery and identify the asset inventory of the organization for classification and reporting. This will serve as a cost-benefit analysis, which will help you justify cyber insurance policy purchases and your security budget. 3.

output.sentence: Using an automated solution that measures the risk of those third-parties based on attack surface assessments for vulnerabilities is an even better first step.

input.paragraph: Board members today are increasingly concerned with cybersecurity risks. Recent Gartner research found “Eighty-eight percent of Boards of Directors (BoDs) view cybersecurity as a business risk, as opposed to a technology risk, according to a new survey * from Gartner, Inc.” It’s not surprising given the increase in threats and vulnerabilities, and the expanding regulatory demands. Board members and leadership must engage in these critical conversations to make sure their organizations are minimizing risk and have a plan for the eventuality of a cyber incident. Here are the top 4 questions you should expect board members to ask you, and how you can best answer them. 1.

output.sentence: By employing an automated platform solution, you can continue to monitor and manage cyber risk more continuously to identify new threats and vulnerabilities to the organization as they develop, than compared to point in time assessments.

input.paragraph: What are the biggest risks to our organization today and what are we doing to mitigate them? Your job as a cybersecurity leader is to manage cybersecurity risk, which includes identifying, treating, and monitoring your overall threat landscape. Your response should include results of a comprehensive cybersecurity risk assessment that was recently conducted through an automated platform solution. By employing an automated platform solution, you can continue to monitor and manage cyber risk more continuously to identify new threats and vulnerabilities to the organization as they develop, than compared to point in time assessments. The platform should present the top risk scenarios to your organization, the associated threats and vulnerabilities that inform risk levels. 2. How are we spending our current cybersecurity budget and is it going to the right places? Justifying cybersecurity budgets can be challenging without having the right risk insights. Using an Integrated Cyber Risk Management platform solution with a financial impact view, you can instantly calculate the annualized loss expectancy (ALE) for your top risk scenarios since the solution can assess your IT environment to discovery and identify the asset inventory of the organization for classification and reporting. This will serve as a cost-benefit analysis, which will help you justify cyber insurance policy purchases and your security budget. 3.

output.sentence: Third-party risk management is a critical component of enterprise risk management.

input.paragraph: Board members today are increasingly concerned with cybersecurity risks. Recent Gartner research found “Eighty-eight percent of Boards of Directors (BoDs) view cybersecurity as a business risk, as opposed to a technology risk, according to a new survey * from Gartner, Inc.” It’s not surprising given the increase in threats and vulnerabilities, and the expanding regulatory demands. Board members and leadership must engage in these critical conversations to make sure their organizations are minimizing risk and have a plan for the eventuality of a cyber incident. Here are the top 4 questions you should expect board members to ask you, and how you can best answer them. 1.

output.sentence: Your job as a cybersecurity leader is to manage cybersecurity risk, which includes identifying, treating, and monitoring your overall threat landscape.

input.paragraph: How are we assessing and mitigating inherent risks linked to third parties? Third-party risk management is a critical component of enterprise risk management. Leveraging a platform solution to assess and monitor third-party risk is the first step, and using an automated solution that measures the risk of those third-parties based on attack surface assessments for vulnerabilities is an even better first step. This method provides up-to-date and accurate information on the actual vulnerabilities of third-party environments linked to your systems. Collaborating with that third party on mitigating inherent risk to your organization requires engaging key resources at the company. This can only be achieved using the platform that provides automated cyber risk assessments, ongoing monitoring, and task collaboration capabilities. 4. How are we benchmarking against peer organizations? Although every organization’s security posture is set up differently, benchmarking is a good way to identify how organizations are managing their risk profiles.

output.sentence: Through both active and passive assessments, you get the most current and accurate visibility of risks your organization is exposed to.
